Gordon et al,
 
I submitted a shakudo mumei tsuba for NTHK ( your branch ) =
shinsa , theme  is 
dragon ascending Mt. Fuji.
The gold ( not paint ) drago=
n is scale for scale ( wiskers, claws too )  
identical to a signed example=
 in Compton's Christie's catalog...........all I  got 
back is Kyo-Kinko ( =
albeit good point score ), at least you guys could have

 school ?? !!

Hi Ron and Jim,

Having seen the menuki, I would agree to the late  Edo c=
all. Also,
dragonflies are a favorite motif of Jakushi, but these do  not c=
ome up to his
level of workmanship. This makes a call really hard, as  Jim =
says, so,
Kyo-Kinko is the attribution of last  resort.

Gordon

Ron,
I didn't say=
 it was hard to date  Kyo-kinko, just impossible to assign to a
group. Ther=
e aren't different  attributions for the different parts of the
Edo period.=
 The NTHK does  assign a period within Edo for every fitting or
koshirae pa=
per:

=E5=88=9D=E6=9C=9F  Shoki (the beginning)

=E5=89=8D=E6=9C=9F Zenki (=
the first part)

=E4=B8=AD=E6=9C=9F Chuki (the  middle)

=E5=BE=8C=E6=9C=9F=
 Koki (late)

=E6=9C=AB=E6=9C=9F Baki (the end)

The NBTHK does  not.

I ca=
n't even guess at a group on the tombo menuki, and that is the  way it is
w=
ith the Kyo-kinko attribution. I didn't see them in Tampa, but  based on th=
e
photos they look like late Edo work.

Agreed with  Gordon's earlier comme=
nt that there are plenty of early solid
gold menuki,  including Ko-mino and=
 Ko-Kinko work in addition to Goto. The
recent NBTHK  AB display and lectur=
e at Tampa included several pairs of solid
gold  mainline Goto menuki from =
the Muromachi and early Edo  periods.

Jim

Subject:  Re: [nihontostudy] Kyo-kinko

Kyo-kinko is non-G=
oto (non-Mino, etc.)  kinko work from after the Momoyama
period. It is ofte=
n applied to work that  is in Goto style but is not Goto
main or sideline w=
ork. Edo-kinko used to  be used similarly for work in the
style of Edo regi=
on machibori kinko  schools, but lately this is generally
lumped as "Kyo-ki=
nko" as well. So it  truly is a grab bag, but the problem
(especially with =
menuki) is that there  is so much Edo period kinko work with
no unique char=
acter to it that makes  it possible to give a more specific
attribution.

B=
TW, generic Edo  period kinko work of lower quality than Kyo-kinko is
attri=
buted to  Kyo-kanagushi.

Jim

Hi Ron,

My understanding is that  Kyo-Kinko is the new name =
for Waki-Goto. This would

make them a grab  bag like Ko-Kinko or even Shoa=
mi. Their dates are post-Ko-
Kinko, so early  Edo to Bakumatsu. There is a =
Kyo-Kinko book out there. I
think the
title  is Kyo-Kinko no Kenkyu (resear=
ch into Kyo-Kinko) or something like
that.  Jim
is probably better up on th=
is stuff then I am.

On on different  note, good luck to Harry. Honto ni ga=
mbatte  kudasai!!

Gordon
